title: Dataproc - Dataproc optional Anaconda component
abstract:
# Dataproc - Dataproc optional Anaconda component
You can install additional components like Anaconda when you create a Dataproc cluster using the [Optional components](/dataproc/docs/concepts/components/overview#available_optional_components) feature. This page describes the Anaconda component.
The [Anaconda](https://www.anaconda.com/distribution/) component is a Python distribution and Package Manager with over 1000 popular data science packages. The component is installed on all cluster nodes in `/opt/conda/anaconda` , and becomes the default Python interpreter. For additional installation information, see [Configure Dataproc Python environment](/dataproc/docs/tutorials/python-configuration) .
content:
## Install the component
Install the component when you create a Dataproc cluster. See [Supported Dataproc versions](/dataproc/docs/concepts/versioning/dataproc-versions#supported_dataproc_versions) for the component version included in each Dataproc image release.
The Anaconda component is not supported in the Dataproc [2.0 image](/dataproc/docs/concepts/versioning/dataproc-release-2.0) . The 2.0 image is pre-installed with Miniconda.
To create a Dataproc cluster that includes the Anaconda component, use the [gcloud dataproc clusters create](/sdk/gcloud/reference/dataproc/clusters/create)  command with the `--optional-components` flag.
```
gcloud dataproc clusters create cluster-name \
    --region=region \
    --optional-components=ANACONDA \
    ... other args
```
The Anaconda component can be specified through the Dataproc API using
 [SoftwareConfig.Component](/dataproc/docs/reference/rest/v1/ClusterConfig#component) 
as part of a
 [clusters.create](/dataproc/docs/reference/rest/v1/projects.regions.clusters/create) 
request.
- Enable the component.- In the Google Cloud console, open the Dataproc [Create a cluster](https://console.cloud.google.com/dataproc/clustersAdd) page. The Set up cluster panel is selected.
- In the Components section:- Under Optional components, select Anaconda and other optional    components to install on your cluster.
